feat: Phase 5 Part 1 - Visual Foundation & Terrain System

Implemented complete visual overhaul and terrain system foundation.

## Visual Enhancements (CSS):
- ✨ Enhanced color palette (Tactical Dark Theme)
  - Elves: #3AA6FF (blue), Dwarves: #FF5A4E (red)
  - 3 terrain colors, HP bar colors, elevation system
- 🎨 Modern typography (Inter + Rajdhani fonts)
- 🏔️ 3D board with tactical grid overlay
- ✨ Enhanced units with glows and radial gradients
- 💚 Color-coded HP bars (green/yellow/red)
- ⚡ Animated highlights (pulsing glow effects)
- 📱 Mobile-responsive design
- ♿ Accessibility (reduced motion support)

## Terrain System:
- 🌿 3 Terrain types with procedural generation:
  - Grassland: Normal movement (cost 1, defense +0)
  - Forest: Slow movement (cost 2, defense +1)
  - Mountain: Very slow (cost 3, defense +2)
- 🗺️ Terrain affects movement costs (BFS pathfinding)
- 🛡️ Terrain provides defense bonuses in combat

## Faction System:
- 🧝 Faction 1: Wald-Elfen (Elves) - Blue
  - Waldläufer, Späher, Bogenschütze
- 🪓 Faction 2: Berg-Zwerge (Dwarves) - Red
  - Schildwache, Minenkämpfer, Armbrustschütze
- 📊 data-attributes for CSS faction styling

## Technical Changes:
- constants.js: +50 lines (TERRAIN_TYPES, FACTIONS)
- state.js: +45 lines (generateTerrain(), faction property)
- map.js: Terrain rendering with CSS classes
- units.js: Movement cost calculation
- combat.js: Defense bonus calculation
- index.html: Google Fonts (Inter, Rajdhani)
- css/style.css: Complete rewrite (~1000 lines)

## Game Balance:
- Forest provides strategic positioning (+1 defense)
- Mountains create chokepoints (+2 defense, cost 3)
- Terrain creates tactical depth without complexity

Impact:
- Professional AAA-indie visual quality
- Strategic terrain gameplay
- Thematic faction identity
- Foundation for future enhancements
